t: Song of Solomon 1
Solomon’s*p Song of Songs.
She
Let*pn him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth— for*ld your love is more delightful than wine.
Pleasing*ln is the fragrance of your perfumes; your*ld name is like perfume poured out. No*ld wonder the young women love you!
Take*ln me away with you—let us hurry! Let*ld the king bring me into his chambers.
Friends
We*pn rejoice and delight in you; we*ld will praise your love more than wine.
She
How*pn right they are to adore you!
Dark*pn am I, yet lovely, daughters*ld of Jerusalem, dark*ln like the tents of Kedar, like*ld the tent curtains of Solomon.
Do*ln not stare at me because I am dark, because*ld I am darkened by the sun. My*ln mother’s sons were angry with me and*ld made me take care of the vineyards; my*ld own vineyard I had to neglect.
Tell*ln me, you whom I love, where*ld you graze your flock and*ld where you rest your sheep at midday. Why*ln should I be like a veiled woman beside*ld the flocks of your friends?
Friends
If*pn you do not know, most beautiful of women, follow*ld the tracks of the sheep and*ln graze your young goats by*ld the tents of the shepherds.
He
I*pn liken you, my darling, to a mare among*ld Pharaoh’s chariot horses.
Your*ln cheeks are beautiful with earrings, your*ld neck with strings of jewels.
We*ln will make you earrings of gold, studded*ld with silver.
She
While*pn the king was at his table, my*ld perfume spread its fragrance.
My*ln beloved is to me a sachet of myrrh resting*ld between my breasts.
My*ln beloved is to me a cluster of henna blossoms from*ld the vineyards of En Gedi.
He
How*pn beautiful you are, my darling! Oh,*ld how beautiful! Your*ld eyes are doves.
She
How*pn handsome you are, my beloved! Oh,*ld how charming! And*ld our bed is verdant.
He
The*pn beams of our house are cedars; our*ld rafters are firs.
